title.narrative: Promoting Equality in Coffee for Enhanced Livelihoods (PECEL)

description.narrative: Lobbying the County Government for a revolving fund of KES 80 million for farm inputs and discussion is progressing well. To support production 25161 seedlings have been grafted for distribution during October rains. Application for a wet mill license made for processing coffee from the union demonstration farm, which is planted with 8200 coffee trees. A package for 12 grams Mt. Kenya Arabica coffee has been developed in response to market demand. In line with We Effect Strategy "Equality first" the male coffee farmers have embraced the importance of the participation of women in coffee farming and have embarked on giving coffee trees to women/portions of farms to plant coffee and the cooperatives are registering the women into their membership.

The goal is to improve farm productivity and incomes by enhancing the participation of women and young people in agricultural production. In order to achieve this, the project aims to create a vibrant union and affiliates practicing equality and providing demand-driven services to their members; enhance advocacy and engagement of the duty bearers to develop & review legislation and policies to make them gender sensitive; improve agricultural productivity and food security for increased incomes; enhance the farmers capacity to adapt to climate change and increase environmental sustainability; increase participation of women and young people in leadership and decision-making processes; increasing women participating in productive social-economic enterprises; increase access to affordable financial services for women, young people and men members and increase access to micro-insurance products and services by the farmers.

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
